page.title: 10Radley College, Abingdon
page.content: Radley College was opened in 1847 by William Sewell who wanted to provide a school where boys would receive a liberal education.Because William was an Oxford Don,Radley College is modelled on the University.The staff are called Dons,the pupils wear gowns and the dining hall is arranged like a refectory in an Oxford College. Radley College is a boys'public school, not a state school.This means it is a fee paying and boarding school.There are 55 full time staff and upto 20 part time staff. The 600 pupils,aged between 13 and 18,come from many countries and all have to pass the Common Entrance Exam to ensure their academic ability.The General School Fee is 1,645 pounds per term.Various Scholarships and Exhibitions allow upto 20 pupils to be assisted with fees each year.
